conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and implications for particle's motion.
Graph shows velocity decreases from positive to zero, becomes negative, reaches minimum, then increases back to zero.
Graph is symmetric around the dashed line, indicating mirror image motion before and after the line.
From t=0 to t0, particle decelerates as velocity decreases from positive to zero.
At t0, particle momentarily comes to rest.
From t0 to t1, particle accelerates in negative direction, reaches minimum velocity, then decelerates to rest at t1.
Symmetry means distance traveled in positive direction before t0 equals distance in negative direction after t0 until t1.
Particle passes through initial position three times: at t=0, after maximum negative displacement, and at t1.
Red arrow at bottom indicates acceleration in negative direction; red arrow at top indicates deceleration in positive direction.
Particle decelerates to stop, accelerates in opposite direction, then decelerates to stop again, retracing path.
